content: 1 mike by the mouse army mitten co knit an easy triangle shawl from the top down this simple triangle can be knit up in just one skein of malabrigo yarn sock or a similar soft sock yarn of equal yardage but you can make it larger easily if you ve got more yarn materials one skein or about 440 yards of malabrigo yarn sock 1 24-48 circular needle in us4-6/3 25-4 0mm or size needed for gauge tapestry needle 1 2 25mm crochet hook for cast on removable stitch marker © 2023 the mouse army all rights reserved 2 gauge gauge is 20 sts and 40 row over 4 /10cm of blocked garter stitch worked flat please be sure to check your gauge especially if you re working this as a one-skein project it cuts pretty close abbreviations used k knit k2tog knit two together a right-leaning one-stitch decease p purl psso pass slipped stitch over ptbl purl through back loop m marker m1l/r make one left make one right a single-stitch increase mst marked stitch here it s not really the middle stitch rh/lh right hand left hand rs/ws right side wrong side sl1 slip one in this project stitches are generally slipped purlwise on the ws and knitwise on the rs ssk slip slip knit a left-leaning one-stitch decrease st/s stitch/es measurements as shown this shawl measures 24 /61cm deep through the center spine and about 56 / 142cm across the wingspan it s easy to customize with more yarn and additional repeats if you d like your shawl to be larger schematic © 2023 the mouse army all rights reserved 3 quick note the simple lace pattern works as a stitch-count-checker since it only works as written over an odd number of stitches if you ve missed a single increase it will become obvious in row 8 also perhaps obviously feel free to substitute yarns add or subtract decreases and so on this is a shawl so gauge isn t crucial and the simple repeat is designed to make it easy to adjust and customize your project to your personal tastes begin work using the crochet cast-on method not provisional just crochet cast on 7 sts row 1 rs sl1 k6 row 2 sl1 p1 k1 p1 k1 p1 p1tbl place a marker on the second purled stitch if you need one it becomes the mst marked stitch row 3 sl1 k1 m1l k1 m1r k1 m1l k1 m1r k2 4 sts increase 11 sts total row 4 sl1 p1 k to mst p1 k to last 2 sts p1 p1tbl row 5 sl1 k1 m1l k to mst m1r k1 m1l k to last 2 sts m1r k2 4 sts increase 15 sts total row 6 sl1 p1 k to mst p1 k to last 2 sts p1 p1tbl *repeat row 5 & 6 twelve times 48 sts overall increase 63 sts total row 7 repeat row 5 4 sts increase 67 sts total row
